intro: Knautia rechingeri, commonly known as the alpine knautia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pink to purple flower clusters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, oval fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes at high altitudes. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
